alert.note: Alert for Granville; Vance; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 30 at 6:28PM EDT until August 30 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Granville County in central North Carolina... Vance County in central North Carolina... Warren County in central North Carolina... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 628 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Henderson, Oxford, Warrenton, Norlina, Kittrell, Middleburg, Macon, Drewry, Afton, Satterwhite Point Marina, Bullocksville, Gillburg, Kerr Lake, South Henderson, Wise, Dabney, John H Kerr Reservoir, Southpointe And Morningstar Marinas and Lake Gaston. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
